reviewText: i did not expect much when i rented this movie form the redbox but a friend of mine reconmend it so i rented it. it is not a great horror film but for a direct to dvd you could do worse. an amereican college wrestling team competing in eastren europe have a wild party one night and oversleep and miss their train to odessa for their next match. the coach is mad but then a woman offers then a ride on a different train heading to odessa. unfortanly it is a front for a black market organ trasplant operation and they are the next unwilling donaters. ture the plot is stupid and is not orignal at all and has a poor script. but the actors did a good job as they could with the matrial and the gore effects were amazing and old school. none of that cgi crap. so that is one place were they hit on all cyinders. so all in all it is a decent horror film and will appeal to gore hounds. just do not expect too much form it
summary: a decent direct to dvd movie

reviewText: Why do they always depict college students as sex crazed, party going, irresponsible, extremely poor judgement of common sense characters in movies.  They also had to include an immature adult male to go along with the adolescent behavior.The plot was farfetched.  Why would anyone be dumb enough to give someone their passport.  Like one reviewer stated, a moving train to steal human organs, come on.  It seems to me that this movie was more about the gore than anything. Toward the end, I started to laugh at the movie.  The guy falling from the train to the rocks below, while missing the water was priceless.  Such as the guy doing the carving throughout the movie, was run over by the train.  How did he roll over on his back when his neck seemed to have been broken?Well for some, I'am sure they will enjoy it.  This is not my type of movie though.

reviewText: Train (2008) is basically "Hostel" and "Turistas" with slightly less gore. The plot is simple. Some American kids end up on an Eastern European train that is in the business of harvesting American organs while the donor is still alive. The kill scenes were decent and included legs removed while conscious, tongue cut out, multiple organ removal scenes while the victims are screaming, spinal cord cut with pruning shears, and burned alive. If you like torture slasher flicks then you might want to give this one a watch...
Title: N/A

reviewText: Those pesky, eastern-European organ thieves are at it again! This time they're using a TRAIN to lure, drug, and dismember unwary westerners! Thora Birch (THE HOLE, DARK CORNERS) is part of a US wrestling team trapped aboard the locomotive slaughterhouse! Yes, TRAIN is extremely reminiscent of both HOSTEL and TURISTAS, w/ all of the same unnecessary surgery and torturous death. Ms. Birch isn't bad in this otherwise goofy film. I especially liked her transformation into action-hero at the end. Hilarious! The final conflict is a blast!...

reviewText: This flick could easily pass as Hostel 3, or Turistas Part 2,and if they slapped either of those titles on it, it probably would have found it's audience with a bit more success.Even Hostel or Turistas "on a Train" would be suitable titles.But to compare Train to it's obvious influences is to both undermine it, and to give away the plot right from the gunshot.Like Hostel 2 you get to see the other side of the equation, which in this film is a lot more compelling.Not only do you see their reason, but their speed bumps as well.Particularly the scene on the cover.It ripped my heart out like a medieval surgeon.Train deserves it's place on the shelf next to its influences, because while yes it's a clone, it's not a thoughtless one.Meaning, Its not without its charms.Make no mistake, this isn't a low-budget rip-off trying to be Hostel.It felt more like an unofficial sequel.If you are a fan of either of those movies, give this one a go.The gore is very much present although the nudity seems to have taken a vacation this time around.PLOT:A group of college wrestlers touring Eastern Europe miss their train having stayed out all night partying.So their bigot coach gets them a trip on a different train, one that harbors a locked train car, and a sinister ulterior purpose.MORAL OF THE STORY:Do not vacation in Eastern Europe!!ALSO RECOMMENDED:Hostel 1 & 2, Turistas, Live Feed, Borderlands, The Ruins, Wolf Creek, Vacancy, Rest Stop, Storm Warning, Frontier(s)GORE:Severed Tongue, Nipple Rip, Open Chest Cavities, Gouged Eye, Burned Alive, Slit Throat, Track-kill, Severed Face, Severed Spine, Rock Smashed Face, Hooked Jaw
Title: N/A

reviewText: Like a diabetic watching their blood sugar level, us gorehounds need to regulate the amount of unrelentless human carnage we inject into our system.  Not enough of the red stuff, we can become moody, irritable pricks.Well rest-assured, TRAIN delivers a satisfying dose of gruesome brutality for all you sick puppies.  Nothing especially groundbreaking, just another sick torture porn tourist trap.  The type of bloody, revolting, take-no-prisoners slasher film that's bound to upset many of you scholarly film snobs.It is a very well-crafted vacation nightmare movie that's jumped on the Hostel bloody bandwagon.  While not quite on par with either of those two Eli Roth flicks, it's not really that far behind either.Thora Birch (American Beauty) gives a very solid lead performance.  She's on a college wrestling team that is headed to their tournament in Europe.  Unfortunately for her and her friends, they hopped on the absolutely worst train.Only in Europe do they perform shady surgical procedures on a train, I guess.  Passengers will have to pay the ultimate price.  This really has great old-fashioned special effects, depicting the most unconscionable examples of human atrocities--castration, mutilation, skin inflammation, throat laceration, deceased fornication, deflammation, deprivation, abrasion...you name it--it's probably here.  Some super sick stuff!Bottom line, TRAIN is much better than expected.  It is extremely derivative but at least it's well made.  Much more than just some cheap ripoff.  Due to the onslaught of graphic images, it had to be edited to shed the NC-17 rating (boo censorship!) and will not appeal to feeble movie watchers.  Proceed with caution.
summary: Gore addicts, here's your daily fix

reviewText: What a horrible film, Thora Birch did her job in the acting department but this film is so damn bad.First of all the plot is so damn stupid you want to commit hara kiri on yourself. First of all 4 wrestlers & 2 coaches miss their train because for unknown reasons they party all night into the morning hours to where they miss their scheduled trains, really ok well we know first off that the 4 wrestlers and assistant coach are dumbasses, the head coach is an idiot to stay and wait for them, should have just left them there.Now they board a sadistic dirty looking train and give their boarding passes to two dirty dudes with no uniforms on who looked like they stepped out of Deliverance. Basically the passengers on the train are transplant patients and the workers on the train kill tourists and what not to get the organs needed for the passengers? WTF!Organ transplant is a delicate procedure when transferring from one person to the next so it doesn't help in one scene they lop off genitalia and a tongue like it's a hickory sausage and just rip out a heart like it's nothing, one of the most important organs in your body being ripped out like that another WTF! Next we have disgusting rape scenes and one which is not shown thank goodness but an insult to soldiers when one of the female wrestlers is used as a bribe and the soldiers gang rape her on the side of the train tracks with the passengers and Thora Birch looking on. IDK Russian soldiers and I'm pretty sure they wouldn't like being perceived that way.The ending is more ludicrous thinking Thora Birch can take down a powerhouse guy that can move a train with his hands and beat the living hell out of her with knockout punches and kicks, gmab! All culminates with her sporting a butch haircut and going to a wrestling meet. Looks like she forgot what happened to her friends and boyfriend on the train.

reviewText: It's been a while since i have seen a really good horror movie that just makes you squirm , jump & just plain weirds you out ...........this one does just that!The 1st half hour of this movie seems like your typical average Teen based horror flick , after that , fasten your seatbelts as the Gore has just begun!! ~~  Nice storyline that keeps you wondering & guessing , some good jump out of your seat parts , great suspense ......The camera work is really great , they did a nice job shooting this & capturing the feel of it just right !! the acting is good & Thora Birch (who is an amazing actress) does not disapoint in the least .....Special effects & gore (which there is a lot of!) look great , the team did such a great job with this movie , best Horror i have seen in a while ..... is it original ?? maybe not , but they take it a step futher & cross a lot of lines to make a great movie for those who love horror , check this out , you may never ride a train again!

reviewText: This is not the intelligent horror movie the director wants you to think it is.  There isn't a single scarey moment in it.  It is gross and it is intense.  It is also brutally realistic pointless gore with a very lame plot.  The actors all do a decent job considering the lame material they have to work with.  The Bulgarian actors are especially good.The story of all this torture being for medical purposes is extremely thin and makes no sense when you think about it.  Do people de penile transplants?  Do people recover from eye transplants in a matter of hours?  Do you really harvest organs with a circular saw in a filthy non-sterile environment?  Heck, do you perform any sophisticated medical procedure on a moving train?  Don't think so.  So, once you come to that conclusion, the story is just idiotic with some great make up.  The train can be a great vehicle for a horror movie, but this totally misses the opportunity to be an intelligent, interesting horror movie.
summary: Gross and Intense yet not Frightening.

reviewText: The only 'good' thing about the movie is that Thora Birch does kick a little ass at the end of the movie. But overall.... ugh.... If you're a horror connoisseur as I am, don't have high hopes. I read some of the reviews prior to watching so I sorta knew what I was getting myself into. It's pretty much exactly as my headline reads: Hostel on a train. The only difference is that the people killing Americans have a purpose other than torture for fun. But honestly, it's such a weak part of the 'plot' that they should have just left it out and kept the kidnap-to-torture/kill routine. The movie is semi-suspenseful at best and the gore is 'decent'.Conclusion: If you're in search of a psychologically twisted, white-knuckle, edge-of-your-seat, turn-on-the-lights-and-lock-the-doors movie, keep looking because this isn't the one. But if you're bored and easy to please, go ahead. Just know that there isn't any amazing award coming towards this movie anytime soon. Or... ever.

reviewText: I rented this movie under the impression that it was a modern day remake of Terror Train.  Instead it is basically Hostel on a train.  A wrestling team traveling throughout Russia and eastern Europe miss there train only to find a woman help them onto another train which goes to their destination.  Only this train is a traveling organ transplant clinic with some unwilling donors.  The movie isn't bad if you like torture horror.  It is not as good as Saw or Hostel, but better fare than say Captivity.  It just feels like it is late to the party and not very original.  If you still love watching Hostel, then by all means you should rent this.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Train (Gideon Raff, 2008)Poor Thora Birch. After thirteen years building a film career, from 1988's loony kidflick Purple People Eater to, arguably, the critical highlight of her career, Ghost World (a movie everyone but me liked, I think), she blundered into one of the most unthinkable errors an actor can make: she starred in a Lifetime Original Movie. Not just appeared in, mind you, but starred. And since Homeless to Harvard: The Liz Murray Story appeared on the Channel of Doom, Birch has appeared in just six features. (Ironically, two of those were in 2009, signaling a possible revival of her career... until she showed up in Pregnancy Pact, another Channel of Doom outing. Sorry, Thora.) And we're not talking American Beauty-level marketing here, either. There was 2004's Silver City, a John Sayles political thriller that, like most John Sayles movies, nobody actually saw in a theater. (This is criminal; John Sayles is a wonderful, highly underrated director.) Then came 2005's Slingshot, which should have been a microbudget indie crime drama, but somewhere found enough funding to cast Birch, David Arquette, Balthazar Getty, and Joely Fisher, all nineties stars on their way down. And then there was Dark Corners, which really was microbudget, at least relative to American Beauty and Ghost World. It's actually not a terrible little film, but aside from a couple of halfhearted festival releases, Anchor Bay consigned it straight to the DVD bin. All this is simply to point out that since Homeless to Harvard, Thora Birch hasn't been able to catch a single break. Which brings us to the fourth of her six features since, Train. Not being able to catch a break for years on end would do wonders to prepare you for the role of Alex, the lady wrestler who, along with some of her teammates, finds herself through some mischance on the way to Odessa, Ukraine, on a train where the crew kidnap out-of-country tourists and harvest their organs. (None of this is a major spoiler, it's in the jacket copy.) Birch is the only actor here with major experience; her co-star mainly does videogame voice-overs, and the rest of the cast sport previous credits like the execrable 2008 remake of It's Alive and the almost as execrable straight-to-DVD flick Grizzly Park. Every time some mildly interesting new detail is revealed about a cast member, you know it will be eventually used to cause that person pain. The direction is barely competent, and this is one of those unfortunate films whose cinematographer mistakes "murky" for "too dark to ever see much of anything". It's an amateur production that would likely never have gotten made (nor have attracted a former star of Birch's stature) had there not been a ravenous appetite for torture porn from studios who should probably have known better (in this case, Millennium, also responsible for the aforementioned It's Alive remake; IMDB trivia mentions this was originally conceived as a remake of the 1980 horror film Terror Train. Among Millenniums' more successful outings recently have been Bad Lieutenant: Port of Call New Orleans and The Expendables). I am far from the kind of person who criticizes torture porn simply for being torture porn; I've always been a champion of both the original Saw and Hostel flicks, and I may be the only critic on the planet who actually liked Turistas. But even as early as 2008, as a subgenre torture porn had gotten pretty long in the tooth, to the point where you can count clichés in this as you go along. It's watchable, in a stupid Sci-Fi Channel Original Movie way, but you'll have forgotten half of it by the time the movie is over. * (For completeness' sake, the other two films that came between the two Lifetime flicks, both after this, were Deadline, a mediocre horror flick now remembered only as Brittany Murphy's penultimate big-screen appearance, and Winter of Frozen Dreams, about which I can't say a single thing, since I haven't seen it.)
summary: Not the worst movie I saw this week...
Title: N/A

reviewText: In the hierarchy of dumb jocks, there is a special place for wrestlers.  So it goes in Train, a poor man's version of Hostel, which in and of itself was a poor man's version of Wes Craven on one of his mediocre days.  If this movie features anything, it is boat loads of stupidity.  Item:  giving your passport to two toothless non-uniformed bullyboys that would make the guys in Deliverance seem suave in comparison.  Item:  having a language meltdown in a train station in a country where it pays for tourists to keep a low profile.  And the granddaddy:  running, with nothing on save a jockstrap, through an entire train full of Russian passengers who already have a somewhat skewed view of Americanism in general.  And the real stumper:  everyone is a wrestler (save for maybe Willie) with some kind of wrestling experience, but no one for most of the film does one physical thing to stay out of harm's way as our Russian sadists pick them off one by one.  So in a nice cosmic way, it makes perfect sense to this writer that the main characters of this film, wrestlers, would be tormented by a bunch of Russian sadists.  Those who have been on the receiving end of wrestler bullies for years would call this comeuppance.  The one star is for Thora Birch, who is always somewhat interesting in any movie she is in.
summary: There is plenty of fun to be had---if you pick some other movie.
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Train" starts out as the usual-A bunch of young Americans in an Eastern Bloc republic-foolishly follow their wrestling coach onto a creepy looking train when the coach is attracted to a frostily attractive woman who has the voice of a man and the heart of a scorpion. On board the train all the personnel are creepy and when two porters who are Russian look-a-likes of the redneck mutants from "Wrong Turn", ask the students for their passports, they hand them over and you know there and then that a certain American wrestling team are about to be body-slammed on scalpels, sledgehammers and grappling hooks.  The train is actually a rolling organ harvesting depot for patients who have the dough to purchase organs to be transplanted into them. The "patients" are allowed to view and approve the organ they need.  One man with a gleam in his eye admires the penis of one of the wrestlers and in a flash of a scalpel a severed penis is dropped into a alcohol filled bottle.  One of the other reviewers has remarked that the movie only shows males being mutilated and butchered but I guess that reviewer missed the scenes of a girl dragged around the train by a grappling hook through her neck and ultimately fed to a dog.Thora Birch the star plays the second female wrestler and she soon kicks slobbering Russian butt and although she is a bit on the slight side to actually believably kick the butt of the slobbering villians especially one brute who is really slobbering-revenge is sweet and satisfying. I kinda enjoyed the movie, not a great movie but a worthy addition to the torture-porn genre and it does deliver on the gore and goo.My only complaint is I wish they had shown the penis of the "patient" who was anxiously looking for a new one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The reason why it was okay? So much of the film takes place on a "train" I get that....does it have to be a very, very dark train, I could not see a good deal of the movie because it was so dark. The plot...bunch of morons go out in Russia after being told not to having just completed wrestling matches and get left behind til a kindly Russian lady offers them a ride. The rest is history. The performances are good, the characters less annoying then usual. Gory and can someone tell me why the girls always survive, well in this one she gives up a guy to get away. I especially liked Gideon emery as the assistant coach and Derek Magyar as Thora Birch's boyfriend.
summary: Typical Saw or Hostel type movie.
Title: N/A

reviewText: At first I found this film hard to get into, it seemed cliched and quite frankly I am sick to death of the latest film concept that every economically depressed eastern European town has to have a huge nightclub that stays packed even on tuesday mornings at 3AM.  Doesn't anybody have to do farmwork?  However, once the story arced in the last third it became very much worth it.  Seeing Thora Birch get in touch with her inner Camille Keaton (look it up, you'll thank me later) while at the same time doing most of her own stunts had me on the edge of my seat!!  Further evidence that direct-to-video is the new grindhouse.  A quality film that has nothing to do with its original concept as a remake of Terror Train.
Title: N/A

reviewText: My whole review is based on spoilers so continue reading at your own risk.How many more friggin' movies are going to show the same "stupid characters behaving like every other stupid character in horror movies". Did the director think it would be fun for the audience to yell "don't do that" or "do something" at the movie?Somebody posted a comment that nails this movie on the head, for a bunch of able-bodied wrestlers, they certainly didn't use their skills to save themselves. When confronted by a menace, they basically let it happen. And if they had something that could be used as a weapon, they either failed to use it, or threw it away. Nobody is that stupid...except the writer of this film apparently.It wouldn't be a lame horror movie if you didn't have the victim subdue the attacker, then drop their weapon and run away so the attacker can chase them. Really?? They're still using that in movies?? First time that was written in a script, it was in hieroglyphics.Gore looked realistic if that's your thing.The saving grace of this movie is the Robin Hood-esque motivations of those running the train. Though that was made evident early on, it was a nice touch to justify this otherwise exercise in futility. Maybe there's some message about Capitalism and exploitation..or maybe eating meat. On a personal note, the movie was also annoying to me because Thora Birch looks too much like Juliette Lewis, whom I can't stand.
summary: Boring collection of horror movie cliches lumped into a 'movie'.
